ClassInfo.description: Class contains all generated message constants for JEAF X-Functions.
ClassInfo.author: JEAF Development Team

Message.name: UNABLE_TO_LOCATE_VERSION_BUNDLE
Message.defaultText: Property file ''{0}'' could not be found within the applications class path.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if a property file that contains version information about an application or software component could not be located within the applications class path.

Message.name: PRODUCT_VERSION_INFO
Message.defaultText: Version: {0}
Message.description: Info-Message contains all relevant version information to analyze an exception.

Message.name: COMPANY_INFO
Message.description: Info-Message is used to trace the company name of a version info object.

Message.name: PRODUCT_INFO
Message.description: Info-Message is used to trace the product name of a version info object.

Message.name: VERSION_INFO
Message.defaultText: anaptecs JEAF-Framework {0}
Message.description: Info-Message is used to trace the version details.

Message.name: APPLICATION_VERSION_INFO
Message.defaultText: {0} {1} (Build date: {2})
Message.description: Info-Message is used to trace the version details of the application.

Message.name: GENERIC_MESSAGE
Message.description: Info-Message is used to trace generic messages

Message.name: CLASS_NOT_LOADABLE
Message.defaultText: Class ''{0}'' could not be found within the classpath.
Message.description: This error code is used by the verifier to indicate that a specific class is not within the application's classpath.

Message.name: NULL_IS_NOT_A_VALID_CLASS_NAME
Message.defaultText: NULL is not a valid class name.
Message.description: This error code is used by the verifier to indicate that a passed class had the invalid value null.

Message.name: SET_IS_INVALID
Message.defaultText: The values ''{0}'' (lower bound) and ''{1}'' (upper bound) do not define a valid set. The lower bound must be less or equal to the upper bound.
Message.description: This error code is used by the verifier to indicate that the passed values do not define a valid set.

Message.name: VALUE_IS_NOT_PART_OF_SET
Message.defaultText: Value ''{0}'' is not part of set [{1};{2}].
Message.description: This error code is used by the verifier to indicate that a passed value is not part of a defined set.

Message.name: OBJECT_IS_NOT_ASSIGNABLE
Message.defaultText: Instances of class ''{0}'' can not be assigned to class / interface ''{1}''.
Message.description: This error code is used by the verifier to indicate that a passed object is not assignable to a class or interface.

Message.name: NULL_IS_NOT_A_REAL_STRING
Message.defaultText: String '{0}' is null.
Message.description: This error code is used by the verifier to indicate that a passed string is null.

Message.name: STRING_IS_EMPTY
Message.defaultText: String '{0}' is empty.
Message.description: This error code is used by the verifier to indicate that a passed string is empty.

Message.name: VERIFICATION_SUCCESSFUL
Message.defaultText: Verification completed without any errors or warnings.
Message.description: This message code is to indicate that a verification result does neither contain errors nor warnings.

Message.name: VERIFICATION_FAILED
Message.defaultText: Verification failed with {0} error(s) and {1} warning(s). \nError(s):{2}\nWarning(s):{3}
Message.description: This error code is used to indicate that a verification failed.

Message.name: CONSTRAINT_CHECK_FAILED_DUE_TO_EXCEPTION
Message.defaultText: Constraint check failed due to thrown ApplicationException. \nOriginal message:\n{0}
Message.description: This error code is used to indicate that a verification failed.

Message.name: VALUE_IS_PART_OF_SET
Message.defaultText: Value ''{0}'' is part of set [{1};{2}].
Message.description: This error code is used by the verifier to indicate that a passed value is part of a defined set.

Message.name: INVALID_SUBSET
Message.defaultText: The set [{0};{1}] is not a subset of [{2};{3}].
Message.description: This error code is used by the verifier to indicate that a passed set is not a subset of the other passed set.

Message.name: SETS_HAVE_NO_INTERSECTION
Message.defaultText: The sets [{0};{1}] and [{2};{3}] have no intersection.
Message.description: This error code is used by the verifier to indicate that the passed sets do not have a required intersection.

Message.name: SETS_HAVE_INTERSECTION
Message.defaultText: The sets [{0};{1}] and [{2};{3}] have an intersection.
Message.description: This error code is used by the verifier to indicate that the passed sets do not have an empty intersection.

Message.name: IS_NULL
Message.defaultText: Object ''{0}'' must be NULL.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if a verification for a null value fails.

Message.name: PATTERN_NOT_MATCHED
Message.defaultText: Character sequence ''{0}'' does not match to pattern ''{1}''.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if a verification for a pattern fails.

Message.name: STRING_TOO_LONG
Message.defaultText: The String ''{0}'' exceeds the maximum length ''{1}''.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if a verification for the maximum string length fails.

Message.name: NO_CURRENT_TRACE_OBJECT
Message.defaultText: Method 'Trace.getCurrentTrace()' must only be called from within a service call.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if the method 'Trace.getCurrentTrace()' is called outside of a service call.

Message.name: COLLECTION_DOES_NOT_HAVE_MIN_SIZE
Message.defaultText: Collection does not contain the minimum size of elements. Expected at least ''{0}'' elements.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if a verification for a minimum collection size fails.

Message.name: COLLECTION_EXCEEDS_MAX_SIZE
Message.defaultText: Collection exceeds the maximum size of elements. Expected not more than ''{0}'' elements.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if a verification for a maximum collection size fails.

Message.name: INVALID_PERIOD
Message.defaultText: Start and end dates do not define a valid period. (Start: {0} End: {1})
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if a verification for a valid period fails.

Message.name: CONSTRAINT_VIOLATION
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if one or more constraint vialoations fail.

Message.name: INTERNAL_ERROR
Message.defaultText: Internal error. {0}
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if an internal error occurs. An internal error are such things as not expected subclass etc.

Message.name: NOT_TRUE
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if an condition is not fullfilled

Message.name: NOT_FALSE
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if an condition is not fullfilled

Message.name: INVALID_EMAIL_ADDRESS
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if a verification for an email address fails.

Message.name: UNEXPECTED_ENUM_LITERAL
Message.defaultText: Internal error. Unable to process unexpected literal '{0}' of enumeration '{1}'.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if an unexpected enumeration literal is met.

Message.name: NO_DATATYPE_CONVERTER_DEFINED
Message.defaultText: No datatype converter defined for combination [''{0}'', ''{1}''] as in- and output type.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if the ConverterRegistry contains no datatype converter for a passed combination of in- and output type.

Message.name: DATATYPE_CONVERTER_ALREADY_EXISTS
Message.defaultText: A datatype converter defined for combination [''{0}'', ''{1}''] as in- and output type is already defined. Existing implementation: ''{2}'', new implementation: ''{3}}''.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if an existing datatype converter illegally should be overwritten.

Message.name: OUTPUT_VALUE_OUT_OF_DATATYPE_BOUNDS
Message.defaultText: The Conversion from ''{0}'' to ''{1}'' failed because the Value of ''{0}'' is out of Bounds of the Datatype ''{1}''
Message.description: Message is used to notify that the Input Value is too Big to convert it to a Value of the Output Datatype.

Message.name: OUTPUT_VALUE_CORRUPTED_DUE_TO_BITSHIFTING
Message.defaultText: The Conversion from ''{0}'' to ''{1}'' failed because the Value of the OutputValue ''{1}'' corrupted through Bit Change
Message.description: Message is used to notify that the Output Value is not equal to the Input Value due to a bitshifting error.

Message.name: OUTPUT_VALUE_OUT_OF_INBETWEENSTEP_DATATYPE_BOUNDS
Message.defaultText: The Conversion from ''{0}'' to ''{1}'' failed because the required InBetweenConversion from ''{0}'' to ''{2}'' was not possible because the Value of ''{0}'' is too High for the ''{2}'' Datatype.
Message.description: Message is used to notify that the Input Value is too Big to convert it to a Value of the Output Datatype because of a required intermeditate Step to another Datatype which is too shortvalued.

Message.name: CANNOT_CONVERT_STRING_TO_CLASS
Message.defaultText: Cannot convert String to Class object of type ''{0}'' due to class loading problems. Propably the class is not available within the class path.
Message.description: Message is used to notify that a a class object could not be created from a string.

Message.name: LOADING_JEAF_PROPERTIES
Message.defaultText: Reading properties from resource ''{0}''.
Message.description: Trace message for reading properties.

Message.name: PROPERTIES_LOCATION
Message.defaultText: JEAF Properties location is ''{0}''.
Message.description: Trace message for location of properties.

Message.name: TRACE_PROPERTY_VALUE
Message.description: Trace message for every loaded property.

Message.name: MALFORMED_URL_PROPERTY
Message.defaultText: Property ''{0}'' contains malformed URL ''{1}''.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code if a resource access providers tries to read an url from a resource but its value is malformed.

Message.name: UNABLE_TO_LOAD_LOCALE_PROVIDER
Message.defaultText: Unable to load locale provider implementation. Using default locale provider instead.
Message.description: Messages with this message id are traced if an exception occurs when trying to load a locale provider.

Message.name: MAX_BASE36_VALUE_EXCEEDED
Message.defaultText: Addition of ''{0}'' and ''{1}'' exceeded the maximum base 36 encoded value.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if the maximum value of a base 36 encoded value is exceeded.

Message.name: INVALID_BASE_36_DIGIT
Message.defaultText: The passed character ''{0}'' does not match the pattern for base 36 digits. Legal digits are '0' - '9' and 'A' - 'Z'.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if an invalid value is used for a digit of a base 36 encoded number.

Message.name: RESOURCE_NOT_FOUND
Message.defaultText: Unable to locate resource bundel ''{0}''.
Message.description: Messages with this message id are traced if an exception occurs when to open a resource bundle.

Message.name: FILE_NOT_FOUND
Message.defaultText: Unable to open file ''{0}''.
Message.description: Messages with this message id are traced if an exception occurs when to open a file as resource.
